title: Fix mobile sidebar Dialog state management bug
description:
## Summary
The mobile sidebar Dialog component in the Dashboard fails to open when the 'Open sidebar' button is clicked.

## Symptoms
- HeadlessUI FocusTrap warning: 'There are no focusable elements inside the <FocusTrap />'
- The sidebar Dialog doesn't render in the DOM even after clicking the button
- React state updates appear to not be triggering properly
- Desktop browsers pass tests (use always-visible sidebar), mobile browsers fail

## Investigation Findings
- The 'Open sidebar' button click is registered by the browser
- React event handlers are attached properly (verified via React fiber inspection)
- The issue appears to be a React hydration mismatch between server-rendered and client-rendered HTML
- This affects Chromium and WebKit mobile device emulation in Playwright E2E tests

## Technical Details
- Component: app/routes/dashboard.tsx
- HeadlessUI version: 1.4.2
- Remix version: 1.2.2
- The Dialog uses Transition.Root with show={sidebarOpen} state

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Run the app locally (npm run dev)
2. Open dashboard on mobile viewport (resize to < 1024px)
3. Click the hamburger menu button ('Open sidebar')
4. Observe: sidebar does not appear

## Recommended Investigation
1. Debug with React DevTools to confirm state updates
2. Check for React hydration mismatches in the console
3. Review HeadlessUI Dialog/Transition component lifecycle
4. Consider upgrading HeadlessUI to v2 which has better static rendering support
close_reason: Fixed in commit 1ea48c1: Replaced HeadlessUI Dialog with native implementation to avoid SSR hydration issues

comments.author: zain
comments.text:
## Investigation Summary

The Playwright installation itself is successful. The actual test failure is due to a **mobile sidebar state management issue** in the application.

### Root Cause
The mobile sidebar Dialog component fails to mount properly when clicking the 'Open sidebar' button:
- **HeadlessUI FocusTrap warning**: 'There are no focusable elements inside the <FocusTrap />'
- The sidebar Dialog doesn't render in the DOM even after clicking the button
- React state updates appear to not be triggering properly

### Test Failures
Both Chromium (Pixel 4) and WebKit (iPhone 11) fail with timeout errors:
1. **Pixel 4**: Timeout waiting for navigation after clicking the logout button
2. **iPhone 11**: Timeout trying to click the 'Keluar' button - element never becomes visible

Desktop browsers (Firefox, Safari) and noscript mode pass because they use the always-visible desktop sidebar.

### Key Findings
- The 'Open sidebar' button click is registered by the browser
- React event handlers are attached properly
- The issue appears to be a **React hydration mismatch** between server-rendered and client-rendered HTML
- This is a **blocking issue** in the application code, not a Playwright/E2E test issue

### Recommendation
This task is actually about a **mobile sidebar component bug**, not the Playwright installation. The E2E test is correctly exposing the bug. The real fix requires:
1. Debugging why the mobile sidebar Dialog fails to mount
2. Investigating React hydration/state management in the Dashboard component
3. Testing with React DevTools to confirm state updates are happening

This should be tracked as a separate application bug rather than a CI/E2E infrastructure issue.

title: Fix full E2E test suite for Docker containers
description:
## Problem
Full E2E tests fail against Docker container because:
1. Tests expect seeded test.db data, but container uses mounted database
2. Magic link fixture file sharing between container and host is complex
3. Database needs to be reset/seeded before each test run

## Current State
- Smoke tests (e2e/smoke.spec.ts) pass - 6/6
- Full suite fails (22 failed, 6 passed, 4 skipped)
- Auth tests fail because session isn't established properly

## Workaround
Use smoke tests for Docker/production validation:
```bash
npm run test:e2e:docker -- e2e/smoke.spec.ts
npm run test:e2e:production -- e2e/smoke.spec.ts
```

## Solution Options
1. Build a test Docker image with baked-in test.db
2. Add Docker Compose for E2E testing with proper volume mounts
3. Create a script that sets up the test environment before running tests

title: Add CI/CD workflow for Kamal deployment
description:
## Overview
Deploy to production via Kamal after tests pass on push to main.

## Tasks
- [ ] Disable Vercel deployments (vercel.json: deploymentEnabled: false)
- [ ] Create .github/workflows/deploy.yml for Kamal
- [ ] Make deploy job depend on test jobs (lint, type-check, unit-test, test)
- [ ] Add Docker layer caching to reduce build time and bandwidth
- [ ] Document required GitHub Secrets in README or docs

## Docker Layer Caching
Use GitHub Actions cache to avoid re-downloading unchanged layers:
- Cache Docker buildx layers between runs
- Reduces deployment bandwidth on VPS
- Speeds up CI/CD pipeline

## Required GitHub Secrets
- SSH_PRIVATE_KEY - Private key for SSH access to VPS
- KAMAL_REGISTRY_PASSWORD - GitHub Container Registry token
- SESSION_SECRET, MAGIC_LINK_SECRET, MAILGUN_SENDING_KEY, MAILGUN_DOMAIN

## Context
Production is now deployed via Kamal to 103.235.75.227. Vercel is no longer used.

title: Server Security Hardening
description:
Optional security improvements for VPS:

1. Disable root SSH login, create sudo user instead
2. Install and configure fail2ban for brute-force protection
3. Consider changing SSH port from 22

Current state (adequate for now):
- UFW firewall active, default deny, only 22/80/443 open
- Password authentication disabled
- SSH key authentication required

title: Set up staging environment
description: Deploy staging environment to the same VPS as production with separate database. Domain: staging.kelas.rumahberbagi.com. Triggered by staging branch. See plan: ~/.claude/plans/fancy-wibbling-toast.md

title: Prepare VPS directories for staging
description:
Create staging directories on VPS:
- /data/kelas-staging/db (for SQLite database)
- /var/backups/kelas-staging-db (for backups)
Set permissions to 755. SSH to 103.235.75.227 and run mkdir commands.

title: Update deployment documentation for staging
description:
Update docs/deployment.md with:
- Staging Environment section
- Staging URL and deployment process
- Database sync instructions
- Kamal commands for staging (deploy, logs, rollback)
- GitHub secrets reference for staging

title: Configure DNS for staging subdomain
description:
Add A record in DNS provider:
- staging.kelas.rumahberbagi.com -> 103.235.75.227
Verify with: dig staging.kelas.rumahberbagi.com
Wait for propagation before proceeding with deployment.

title: Set up Mailgun staging subdomain
description:
Configure Mailgun for staging emails:
1. Add domain staging.mg.rumahberbagi.com in Mailgun dashboard
2. Add required DNS records (SPF, DKIM, CNAME)
3. Verify domain in Mailgun
This ensures staging emails are clearly separated from production.

title: Add staging secrets to GitHub
description:
Add new secrets in GitHub repo Settings > Secrets:
- STAGING_SESSION_SECRET (openssl rand -hex 32)
- STAGING_MAGIC_LINK_SECRET (openssl rand -hex 32)
- STAGING_MAILGUN_DOMAIN (staging.mg.rumahberbagi.com)
Existing secrets SSH_PRIVATE_KEY and KAMAL_REGISTRY_PASSWORD are reused.

title: Create Kamal staging configuration
description:
Create config/deploy.staging.yml with:
- service: kelas-staging
- host: staging.kelas.rumahberbagi.com
- volume: /data/kelas-staging/db:/app/prisma
- DATABASE_URL: file:/app/prisma/staging.db
- STAGING_ENVIRONMENT: true
Use config/deploy.yml as template. See plan for full config.

title: Create GitHub Actions staging workflow
description:
Create .github/workflows/deploy-staging.yml:
- Trigger on staging branch push + workflow_dispatch
- Same quality gates (lint, typecheck, unit, e2e tests)
- Build Docker image with staging-SHA tag
- Deploy using kamal deploy -c config/deploy.staging.yml
- Use STAGING_* secrets
Use deploy.yml as template. See plan for full workflow.

title: Create database sync script for staging
description:
Create scripts/sync-staging-db.sh to copy production data to staging:
1. Stop staging container
2. Backup current staging.db
3. Copy prod.db to staging.db using sqlite3 .backup
4. Restart staging container
Deploy to /usr/local/bin/sync-staging-db.sh on VPS.

title: Create staging backup script
description:
Create scripts/backup-staging-db.sh similar to production but with:
- 7-day retention (vs 30 days for prod)
- Backup dir: /var/backups/kelas-staging-db/
- File prefix: staging_
Optional: Add cron job for daily backups at 4 AM.

title: Add staging environment indicator
description:
Optional: Add visual staging indicator:
1. Yellow banner at top of page when STAGING_ENVIRONMENT=true
2. [STAGING] prefix in email subjects
Modify app/root.tsx and app/services/email.server.tsx.
